title: datalad diff -r   to be depth first
body:
#### What is the problem?
ATM it first lists differences at the top level -- i.e. changed subdatasets, and then goes in detail for subdatasets.  IMHO it would be better if differences within a subdataset came right after declaring having the difference in that subdataset, i.e. instead of 

```shell
$> datalad diff -r       
   modified(dataset): ds000164
   modified(dataset): ds000177
   modified(dataset): ds000218
   modified(dataset): ds000253
      modified(file): ds000164/dataset_description.json
           deleted(): ds000177/CHANGES-ds177_R1.0.0_all_data
           deleted(): ds000177/README-ds177_R1.0.0_all_data
           deleted(): ds000177/T1w-ds177_R1.0.0_all_data.json
      modified(file): ds000218/CHANGES
           deleted(): ds000218/CHANGES-ds000218_R1.0.1_metadata_derivatives
           deleted(): ds000218/participants-ds000218_R1.0.1_metadata_derivatives.tsv
      modified(file): ds000253/.datalad/meta/meta.json
      modified(file): ds000253/dataset_description.json
```

```shell
$> datalad diff -r       
   modified(dataset): ds000164
      modified(file): ds000164/dataset_description.json
   modified(dataset): ds000177
           deleted(): ds000177/CHANGES-ds177_R1.0.0_all_data
           deleted(): ds000177/README-ds177_R1.0.0_all_data
           deleted(): ds000177/T1w-ds177_R1.0.0_all_data.json
   modified(dataset): ds000218
      modified(file): ds000218/CHANGES
           deleted(): ds000218/CHANGES-ds000218_R1.0.1_metadata_derivatives
           deleted(): ds000218/participants-ds000218_R1.0.1_metadata_derivatives.tsv
   modified(dataset): ds000253
      modified(file): ds000253/.datalad/meta/meta.json
      modified(file): ds000253/dataset_description.json
```
